TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataKey extends System.Object implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey>, class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Docs.summary: Represents the primary key field or fields of a record in a data-bound control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataKey class is used to represent the primary key for a record in a data-bound control. The primary key for a record can be composed of one of more fields from the data source. Although the DataKey class is not a collection, it can store multiple key field values. The key field values are populated when one of the constructors for the DataKey class is called. You can retrieve a key field value from a DataKey object in the following ways:
- Use the [Item\<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.Int32%29?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve a key field value at a specific index in the DataKey object.
- Use the [Item\<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve a key field value of a specific field.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Value%2A> property to retrieve the value of the key field at index 0 in the DataKey object. This property is often used as a shortcut to retrieve the key value of a record when the primary key contains only one field.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to create an <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object that can be used to iterate through the key field values.
In general, DataKey objects are automatically generated by data-bound controls when the control's `DataKeyNames` property is set. The DataKey objects contain the values of the key field or fields specified in the `DataKeyNames` property. Data-bound controls that display a single record at a time (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>) generally store the DataKey object for the current record displayed in the `DataKey` property of the control. Data-bound controls that display multiple records at a time (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>) generally store the DataKey objects for each record in the control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection is then stored in the `DataKeys` property of the control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to determine the primary key value of a record in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Value%2A> property of a DataKey object.
[!code-cs[DataKeyValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_175_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DataKeyValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_175_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary keyTable) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the key field values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified dictionary of key field values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class using the specified dictionary of key field values. The field values contained in the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `keyTable` parameter are used to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
> [!NOTE] > This version of the constructor does not allow you to specify a list of field names in advance for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object. Because the field names are not specified in advance, both the field names and values are stored in view state. To specify a list of field names in advance, use the [DataKey(IOrderedDictionary,â€‚String\<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%29> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary keyTable, string[] keyNames) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of strings that contain the names of the key fields.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names. The field values contained in the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `keyTable` parameter are used to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object. This constructor also allows you to specify a list of the key field names for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object in advance through the `keyNames` parameter. Because the field names are specified in advance, only the key field values are stored in view state when this constructor is used.

## Remarks The IsTrackingViewState property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object is tracking its view-state changes.
> [!NOTE] > This property is used primarily by control developers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Item property to retrieve the value of the key field at the specified index in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can also use the [Item\<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.String%29> property to retrieve a key field value by field name.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Item property to retrieve a key field value from a specific index in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Item property to retrieve the value of the specified key field from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can also use the [Item\<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.Int32%29> property to retrieve a key field value by index.

Docs.summary: Loads the previously saved view state of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](../Topic/ASP.NET%20State%20Management%20Overview.md).
The LoadViewState method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the key field at index 0 in the object.
Docs.value: The value of the key field at index 0 in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to retrieve a key field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object, you can use the Value property as a shortcut to determine the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object. This property is commonly used to determine the key field value of a record when the record has only one key field.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object does not contain any key fields, `null` is returned.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Value property to determine the primary key value of a record.
[!code-cs[DataKeyValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_988_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DataKeyValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_988_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets an object that contains every key field in the object.
Docs.value: An that contains every key field in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Values property to retrieve an <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object that contains every key field in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object. The <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object is often used to iterate through the key fields of a record.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object returned by the Values property.
[!code-cs[DataKeyValues#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_536_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DataKeyValues#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_536_1.aspx)]
